definitions: a spot or patch appearing from time to time on the sun's surface, appearing dark by contrast with its surroundings.

notes.text: Sunspots are regions of lower surface temperature and are believed to form where loops in the sun's magnetic field intersect the surface; an individual spot may persist for several weeks. The number of sunspots on the solar surface fluctuates according to a regular cycle, with times of maximum sunspot activity recurring every eleven years

shortDefinitions: spot or patch that appears from time to time on sun's surface

definitions: a dark or discolored spot on the skin caused by exposure to the sun

examples.text: wrinkles, sunspots, and uneven skin tone and texture can all be traced to unprotected sun exposure

shortDefinitions: dark spot on skin caused by sun

definitions: a place that receives a lot of sunshine

examples.text: the company operates flights to southern European sunspots
